subject: Re: [junit] @BeforeClass throws NullPointerException

messageBody:
hyca51 wrote:

> My test class:
> public class StackTests {
> private Stack stack;
>
> @BeforeClass public void init() {
> stack = new SimpleStack();
> }
>
> @Test public void isEmpty() {
> Assert.assertTrue(stack.isEmpty());
> }
>
> static public junit.framework.Test suite() {
> return new JUnit4TestAdapter(StackTests.class);
> }
> }

My guess is that @BeforeClass can only set class-level variables. This
makes some sense, because @BeforeClass implies that there isn't
necessarily an instance of the test case yet. It's not immediately
obvious, but it makes sense after a few moments' thought. If I were a
beginner with Java and JUnit, it would confuse the hell out of me.

I think you should just use @Before and not @BeforeClass. Don't do
class-level setup as a performance hack; it creates more problems than
it solves.

Take care.
